values:
Well, now that I'm here I might as well give a real update.
Starting classes back in the fall. Looks like I'm going to be going for a Masters in Heritage Preservation with a focus in Historic Preservation. I'm really excited because one of my first classes is totally getting to dig through some of the apartments on the Martin Luther King Jr. historic site in order to get official documentation for anybody looking to do something with those apartments. Apparently they're pretty shady, but I'm not going to complain because I get to crawl through their attics. I'm reminded of when we got to go into the ceiling at Chartres... what is with me and getting to crawl around in the dirt of old buildings? It's so freaking awesome!

On a similar note, work is trying to keep me full time. One of our HRs has nominated me to corporate to interview for a co-op their doing with their social media. What do you know, Home Depot's  twitter and facebook aren't updated enough (do they even have anything?) and they're trying to get with the times, and so will be really working on that department and I'm getting interviewed. Haven't heard anything in about a week but she definitely sent my name in so I'm pretty excited to even be nominated. Of course it means more work but who cares? OMG did I mention here that I'm finally a Head Cashier now? Thank goodness I'm doing SOMETHING that doesn't feel quite like a dead-end anymore. At least now I can claim I got a raise/promotion and I'm at least MICROmanaging, right? Come the release of the hiring freeze that might actually mean something.

I need to hurry and download all the DLC for Dragon Age now, though, and play through it quickly while I have the time. I'm still squeeing a little over some of the Awakening stuff that I haven't even had the time to try out Darkspawn Chronicles or Leliana's Story, which I'm super excited about. I absolutely love her, almost as much as I adore Alistair. Kris gets so tired of hearing about it... Alastair at work, too, come to think of it. Poor boy has to suffer my amusement just because I love his name. It helps that he's a total sweetheart but nothing like the pixelated object of my affections. Bioware is so bad for my irl relationship, haha. Not that the pending FFXIV is making this any easier. I may need to look into a new computer for that and just learn how to multitask my games, since the PS3 version is coming out a whole 6 months later (wtf?)

Anyway, Aqua Teen is coming on the television so I think I'm going to take over and actually play some Dragon Age while Kris is distracted with Monster Hunter. God knows he dislikes ATHF about as much as I do. Alistair, it is time to rule together!!!

I'm making an insignificant post just to remind myself that I am running a relatively meaningless blog.

On that note, the dog I wanted was adopted and I'm very glad it found a new home... but now Kris is taking me shelter-shopping and I'm so excited! We're going as soon as we get back Tuesday.

I'll be at the Gulf pretty much until then. Going to visit the Gramps on the oil-free bay (thank goodness!)

Got a week before I finally have off for Ben and Lucy's wedding. I am SO looking forward to this vacation, I feel like I need it so bad.

Bad part is, soon as the summer starts I'm all screwed because I've already had my vacations for the year and I won't be able to afford taking off any more. What will there be to look forward to besides I guess Dragon*Con in September and Christmas after that?

Who knows. I'm sure we'll find something. Maybe I'm just in a really weird mood today.

I don't want to go into work today! I have to work the closing shift for PBC (that's the pro end by lumber and building materials... although I wonder what PBC actually stands for...) which is always ALWAYS slow. Somebody come visit me at the Vinings location to say hello? Lol.

Otherwise been a boring day. I like getting up at 7, as I have been lately, because normally I wouldn't be up until now or later and already I've gotten done more than I would like for the day. Which is, of course, grow nearer to completing this game with which I am totally and shamelessly obsessed. Awesome.

P.S. Didn't do wings last night because it turns out Luke had a date. Best of luck to him, ne?

An update for updates' sake. Took my car in for the brake update today. It was only supposed to take about thirty minutes but in reality took about two and a half hours. Oh well. Day wasted pretty well, considering now my car is all no-longer-recalled and the tire pressure is good again. Maybe I'll get the mileage I'm supposed to be getting with it now.

Going to Varner's tonight with Luke and Kris for 1/2 price wings, too. Kris actually had wings yesterday when we went to Taco Mac with my family -- family being mom and dad and my dad's visiting sister +children but that's ok, he really likes wings.

Anyway, I'm going back to playing Dragon*Age now to try to get this infatuation with this game out of my system. Really, this much role playing cannot be healthy for a girl!

Ok, ok. In defense of myself, my laptop has totally quit on me and I just haven't found the time to send it in for repairs. So I've gotten most of my internet fix for the past week of my phone, which is far less than ideal.
But I'm still here, I promise, and I have at least had lj on my mind nearly every day.
A lot has happened since... a week ago? Mike was in for the weekend to celebrate my father's birthday, in which I gave him the wonderful surprise of seeing my brand new tattoo.

Heck yeah I finally got that tattoo. But I'm waiting for it to heal before I really start letting people see it. Mom's reaction was bad enough (and I know I'm not convincing her it's perfectly healthy until it actually LOOKS it). But I haven't had a single regret yet.

And I'm looking to move up at work. Most of my coworkers agree to it, it's just a matter of convincing management that I'm ready. That would be nice. The application is in, anyway. Hopefully I'll get interviewed in the near future.

And this mac sucks. Sorry Kris, I will never be an Apple person. I can't type on this thing worth nothing. So I'm calling out now, and hopefully will see you guys in the near future with another entry.

So I'm relaxing at home now and instead of cooking up a mean stir fry like we were supposed to do or finishing my graduate application like I desperately need to do, I'm browsing the internet and checking out all my old stuff.

I've just decided that tags in journals shouldn't exist as they seem to be peculiarly worded (as my own failures reveal) and take me back to times I don't think I really want to read about. How embarrassing!

But it feels so good relaxing after a hard days' work of dealing with returns. Honestly, one would think that people could just be honest for a change instead of returning all their stolen shit and making me deal with their insolence. And how about just taking it out of the packaging at the store? Filled an entire Homer Bucket (that's 5 gallons) with empty packages that we found in our clean up yesterday. They all had to be marked down and marked up to make sure we got them correctly documented, and it was almost tragic looking at the dollar amounts. Oh well. HD isn't missing out on too much I guess.

I need to get in touch with techops, too. I'm hoping to volunteer for Dragon*Con this year and techops is the place I want to be. Now if only the website would e-mail me back, that would be fantastic...

And in other news, upon failing to post this entry I discovered that posting it on my cell apparently puts the entries like 6 hours in the future. Will not be posting from the phone until I figure out how I did this.
So I'm testing this out to see how it works on my phone. I guess so far so good. Maybe this evening I can test it out further... and clean up my friends page.

So in order to try to perhaps motivate myself better, the icon and background is new.

On similarly upbeat notes, I got my third Homer Badge today which means fun rewards in my next paycheck, and I won the dirtiest associate award for our rack diving -- a yearly process which involves cleaning out all the shelves in the store and usually encountering a number of questionable year-old things including small dead rodents (not me, thank goodness), cobwebs, and leftover charcoal/box cutter blades/screws/etc.
But the reward for being dirty was quite nice.

P.S. Note to self to finish your damn graduate app tomorrow or so help me God GSU isn't going to let you in.

God I haven't even given this page thought in I don't even know how long. But I was here to get the link for twitter and thought it maybe nice to let lj know I am still alive.

And facebook is charging in the near future? Perhaps lj will become my hangout spot again.
It just occurred to me today that I can no longer just hop on the metro and go to anywhere in Paris that I want to be.

I'm feeling exceptionally lethargic and very much like I'm not giving much to my surroundings. Of course, this probably has something to do with it being nearly 2AM and definitely everything to do with being addicted to websites that base your influence on the world on how many visitors you have.
Maybe I should do something.

Too bad starting a cooking blog is already taken. Kris and I are getting desperate for a real meal rather than something microwaved out of a box. Hmm...

I think the hardest part about being away from livejournal for so long is coming back and trying to catch up on my friends list reading and usually doing it backwards.

Oh well, I had a valid excuse this time, because I was travelling Eastern Europe. Or, as western as you can get in Eastern Europe. Regardless, it was a wonderful trip. I'm glad it's already made though, because we're about to do a tour of the British Isles + Copenhagen and I've been looking forward to this trip since we started planning it. Hopefully it goes as well as it feels like it will go.

There was also something strangely elating about being in a beautifully old city -- Prague -- on Easter. I'm so glad I got to experience it.

My last few posts have been riddled with a countdown of sorts until I don't have to deal with the COA anymore and I'm sure it's been mentioned before, but I just have to let out this celebratory bark to my beloved undergraduate college for whom I have finally completed my coursework:


So long, and thanks for all the fish.

I'm feeling super nostalgic today. I think it may be because all of my classes with the exception of studio are completely finished and I'm left either sewing or thinking about graduation.
Hardly related.
Anyway, I really miss you guys. And by you guys, I mean the high school gang and probably the only ones who know about the location of this journal, heh. But yeah. I lost contact with almost everybody pretty badly in my own attempts to find time for myself.
I'm sorry and I miss you.

Meh. I need to get this thing sewn together so class can be finished and we can be traveling again. We have a great itinerary set up for the second half of April and then I get to come home, finally.

Home. I'm so close.
P.S. French theater is weird. If somebody can explain to me anything about Caroline et Casimir (or is it Casimir et Caroline?), I'd be mighty grateful, lol.

We're nearing the end of the semester rapidly (7 days of classes left, to be precise... not that anyone is counting) and that means graduation is right around the corner.

Finally.

Ah, but there is so much work to do before then. We went to fabric store today to try to pick out some kind of fabric for our 'wearable architecture' and I couldn't really find anything in appropriate colors. I'm trying not to worry too much because it looks like I can get away with about 8 euro more than I'm supposed to and that SHOULD be enough to buy the really pretty fabric that I found. Now I just have to get to constructing this... thing. Hopefully pictures will come up on facebook or something. I'm really excited to see the finished product.

And then there's like, 2 papers due in the near future, but see if I let myself start worrying about those.

Eh well. Graduation finally, right?

P.S.
Obsessions are so unhealthy for my educational endeavors.

I'm so close to coming home!!! I feel like I've been out to sea or something.
Anyway, I just wanted to gush about the house-hunting we've been doing. Found some that look promising and I really wish I was there to go look at them or something because I don't want these to slip through our fingers... Eh, well, there are always other houses, I guess, and probably another 8 or 9 months before the housing market picks back up again. I have no reason to worry.

I AM, however, stuck trying to figure out what I want to do in the next year. I think I'm going to apply to GSU since they're still taking applications. Just need my profs over here to accept my recommendation letter requests... guess I should ask them first.
Hmm. Do I really want to start grad school soon as I get back?
Or do I want to hunt down an internship?
Or can I really afford to just take a nice lax job like a bookstore and let it ride til August.

Choices...

Wow, I haven't updated since living in the states.

I'm sorry for neglecting you, lj. I... don't promise to keep it up.
Got to Paris ok, for anybody reading a few posts down, heh.

Loved it so far. I don't really like the people but the country is beautiful, the eats are nummy, and the travel is abundant. We're going to the Netherlands and then to Italy come late February. I should record everywhere I've been so far.

Oh well. Bit tired now, and I just got back from a party where I know they spiked the punch (main ingredient: vodka!), but maybe I shouldn't have had so much. XD


P.S. I'm having a relapse on my mourning of Fred Weasely. How tragic is that?

Known about it's existence but haven't really looked much into it. Then I saw this:

http://www.latinoreview.com/script-reviews/?id=65

Two words.

FUCK. YES.

I am so nervous right now that I applied too late for my visa. I think the consulate said expect a month and a half and I applied a month and a week before leaving, and then had to mail in a document.

To be honest, I'm so looking forward to studying in Paris that if something falls through I'm not really sure what I am to do. This is the only thing about which I am nervous.

And I am panicked.

But writing this calms me down a little. Thanks for listening/reading.

I don't post much, but I thought this was interesting and worth sharing.

It's a documentary definitely worth the effort. http://wideeyecinema.com/?p=105

I'm on a roll mostly because I'm at work and when lj comes to mind, I just can't stop. Wish it happened everyday.
Anyway, I just stumbled upon this post by <lj user="sushikat"> and couldn't resist. But I'm going to be doing tagging. >.> Which is everybody.

Once you've been tagged, you have to write a blog w/ 10 weird, random things, facts, habits or goals about yourself. At the end, you choose 10 people to be tagged, listing their names & why you chose them. Don't forget to leave them a comment or message saying "You're It!" and telling them to read your blog. You can't tag the person who tagged you. Since you can't tag me back, let me know when you've posted your blog so I can see your answers.

1. I really like to read fanfiction. I think it's more comfortable for me because I already recognize the characters, I can get a wide range of writing styles (from terrible texter to Shakespeare), and when you read fanfics you are almost in complete control of the story line. Don't like what happened in the latest part of your chronicles? That's okay, there's a fanfic out there for you and you won't be dissatisfied.

2. I would kill to be part of some sci-fi/fantasy story. Seriously. It is my one unattainable dream.

3. Shoes are my life. My clothes may be bland, but I take pride in my accessories and my shoes.

4. There are three careers I would love to take when I "grow up": Actress, Writer, Archaeologist; I'm too greedy to risk not making enough money to try to take them. I stick to Architecture because it lets me design and that's pretty fun, too.

5. I tend to be a bit of a bitch, but really it's just because I'm stronger and more stubborn than you.

6. I'm more self-conscious than I let on. Really, I'm mostly just afraid I'm the chick forcing others to hang out with me because they can't say no.

7. I'm a total nerd when it comes to games and TV. If it isn't strategy, science, or a comedy, you can pretty much count me out. Discovery, Nat'l Geographic, and SciFi are my life though Cartoon Network gets its own air time, too.

8. I've been with Kris for four years and dammit, I plan to be with him twenty fold more -- if that was a surprising fact at all.

9. I terrified about living in France for a year. People keep telling me how different it is and what a culture shock I'll be having. Still, there's a part of me that's telling me I'm finally free and I really can't wait.

10. Erm....Oh! Traveling... is my thing. Be it a long nature hike and a campsite or a nice stay in a resort, if it's not in a familiar environment chances are I love it.

Ten Top Trivia Tips about Mikki!

  1. More people are killed by Mikki each year than die in aeroplane accidents.
  2. The Aztec Indians of Mexico believed Mikki would protect them from physical harm, and so warriors used her to decorate their battle shields.
  3. Plato believed that the souls of melancholy people would be reincarnated into Mikki.
  4. Mikki can fly at an average speed of fifteen kilometres an hour.
  5. Twenty-eight percent of Microsoft's employees are Mikki.
  6. If you drop Mikki from the top of the Empire State Building, she will be falling fast enough to kill before reaching the ground.
  7. Mikki was first discovered by Alexander the Great in India, and introduced to Europe on his return.
  8. Michelangelo finished his great statue of Mikki in 1504, after eighteen months work.
  9. Scientists believe that Mikki began billions of years ago as an enormous ball of dust and gas!
  10. Europe is the only continent that lacks Mikki.
I am interested in - do tell me about

You are everything and have everything I could ever want.
If I were leading a less happy life, I know I would envy you so much I hate you.

I AM happy, but I am still jealous. Why do you still bother me? I don't NEED what you have. I barely even WANT it.

Should I be relieved that THIS bothers me?

Remember, remember the Fifth of November, The Gunpowder Treason and Plot, I know of no reason Why Gunpowder Treason Should ever be forgot. Guy Fawkes, Guy Fawkes, t'was his intent To blow up King and Parliament. Three-score barrels of powder below To prove old England's overthrow; By God's providence he was catch'd With a dark lantern and burning match. Holloa boys, holloa boys, let the bells ring. Holloa boys, holloa boys, God save the King!

...........I have very little to talk about.
And yet so much at the same time.

My fan crushes don't help even in the least bit (hint -- I can't bring myself to use my default icon right now)

But yeah. Dragon*Con, just so everybody knows, was absolutely AWESOME. I'll update about it when I actually have some free time.
Katie, we were discussing this in the car about BP, and then I found this article. Thought you might like to see, lol. BP gets ok to dump mercury into Lake Michigan

This is a beautifully sad fic for anybody craving closure like I was. Obviously, it's a bit of a spoiler, but of all the stories I've read tonight this was the one to make me cry. Again. If you know why I'm so upset about the book (and not the writing flaws), you should know what this is about. I won't say more. Beautiful. But really sad, as a warning. It's a sad, sad spoiler for HP.

Ok, I'm feeling better. I can't help it if I get overly emotional over things I get too attached to. Anyway, I must warn you and I'm angry, so brutal. I guess I'm going to start at the end, since it's probably the only thing I truly believe shouldn't have been written (as opposed to shouldn't have happened T_T). We've been reading the Harry Potter series for how long now? And every time a new one comes out, understandably it has skipped most of the summer following the last year of school, but never really anything major. And if we really missed something major, Rowling is sure to tell us all about it in her, "Here's what happened in every book before this in case you're too stupid to go read those, too." (To be honest, I didn't mind the updates too bad after all) I can even accept, with open arms, thanks, the huge time skip in the beginning following Harry's delivery to the Dursleys. It was appropriate, it was explained rather vividly. To be blunt, I liked the prologue. The epilogue, I think, needs to be ripped from the book. For starters, it jumps way too far in the future. Sure, 19 years seems a good idea if you're just randomly picking a number and then saying Harry had kids when he was early twenties (a bit early for me, but who's judging?) Except not really, because any good literature buff knows the worst way to finish a book is to do a huge time skip and show everybody how much breeding has been happening while we were away and most likely wondering what happened to the after. For a children's book, it's almost forgivable. For Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, a very much NOT children's book, it's a sorry excuse to make the ending HAPPY HAPPY HAPPY. What happened with cleanup? How was the ministry fixed? Did Percy finally fulfil his dream of becoming Minister? How did they gather the remaining Death Eaters?Did Ron finally magically forgive Harry for having been an ass to his sister? Draco married some nameless face? Is she a muggle or a halfwitch or a pureblood? Questions all dodgedly answered with a vague, "yes, they happened." And what about the unanswered questions? Like why Luna and Dean suddenly seem like a feasible couple at the end of the book (or did I read too far into the hand holding?) What happened to Luna anyway? Because I also thought she'd end up with Neville, and I was really pretty ok with that, too. I guess we'll never know for poor Luna Lovegood.Who the hell became Minister of Magic immediately following? Do we just assume Percy, or was somebody more worthy given the position first? I personally think Kingsley should have (unless I missed him dying, of which I wouldn't be surprised). And who else died? Is Kreacher alive? Surely in the group when Harry knew practically EVERYBODY fighting, he's going to know more than the 6(?) people bothered to be listed--50 other casualties occur. Which brings up another [rather touchy] point and the whole reason I'm still suseptible for boohooing. It's not about Remus and Tonks, or Hedwig, or poor Snape. It's about the overlooked twin. I mean, seriously. I went into this book telling myself this: I'm going to be perfectly ok with anybody who dies as long as the twins come out ok. They're my favorite character, and I say it like that because despite how many twins spend their lives defining themselves from the other, Fred-and-George were just that, a character. They pranked together, ate together, played together, left Hogwarts together, lived together, worked together. Everything, together, until book 7. I had a bad feeling when suddenly the plans meant the twins had to split up, and sure enough the mentioning of specifically Fred and George not returning at the beginning of the book raised some serious fears in me. And of course, George lost an ear, but it's ok because even he was able to joke about it (a relieved sigh actually escaped my lips upon his pathetic line about Sainthood, but Fred was right, what a sorry joke). However, when the book started focusing more on Fred than George (who only appeared everytime all the Weasleys were there and spoke very little as opposed to Fred's pretty steady conversation and appearance on Potterwatch, and then when the twins yet again split up, I suspected something was very, very wrong. It sure doesn't help that they seem most forgiving to Percy (with whom they were probably closer than most), or that of course Percy went with Fred. Of course he had to die. One of the Weasleys did, and all the others with whom we're already familiar have had horrible things happen to them in the past. No, the part that particularly bothers me about the death of Fred Weasley is that it really is JUST Fred, not George too. And what happens to our grieving twin, who by far probably suffers the most (exlcuding those who actually die)? Who knows, Rowling doesn't even cover it. No matter that George may never be the same person again, that Weasley's Wizarding Wheezes may be forever lost, that the infamous Weasley twins will never cause stress and chaos again. It was only Fred, and not Harry or Ron or Ginny (and personally, I wouldn't have minded seeing Ginny or Percy go in Fred's stead). Speaking of characters whose stories should have gone differently , poor Snape. I mean, is it ever clear whether or not the man was on Dumbledore's side in the end? Even so, what a sorry and abrupt way to die. And then to have your sorry past read out like a fanfiction (one of which I'm sure I've read before. Maybe Rowling borrowed some text from ff.net?) It seemed rather childish to me, but I suppose it's another of those OMG WE HAVE TO MAKE IT END WELL SO FLUFF FLUFF FLUFF. A bit like Dumbledore, unfortunately, whose monologuing I had to stop reading for a bit just to take a breather from the angst. Seriously, I could have definitely gone without Albus belitting himself to the point of annoying. We got the story three times in the book before, we didn't need it from another persective. Harry had already worked it out, and so had we. Albus really should have just stayed dead. Honestly, a whole chapter to tell Harry he can and probably should just go back? Ridiculous. Quite a few other things made me a bit edgy about the writing, but I'm kind of tired of being bitter, so let's discuss things I thought went well. Like Neville Longbottom, whose growing importance in these books has captured me and made me absolutely love his character. The boy can do no wrong, aside from his pseudo-squibdom, which has clearly passed. He's noble, not that bad looking after all, pretty smart, not angsty in the face of certain and passed doom(unless SOME heroes we know), and brave when he needs to be. Not to mention a constant source of entertainment. But I was so glad when he appeared in the mirror. The boy's absolutely selfless, and has been in the whole series, and who doesn't admire him for that? He maintains Dumbledore's Army despite his weaknesses and takes absolute and total shit from Death Eaters the whole time he's at Hogwarts. Honestly, the boy undergoes torture for Harry. And then for him to be honorable enough to freaking kill the snake after being on FIRE? I love this boy. To pieces. Molly Weasley used the word bitch. Sketchy. Awesome. Kick ass, woman. Exceptionally frightening knowing [one of] her son[s] is dead, and I can't believe Bella had the nerve to bring it up. Crazy lady. Ron and Hermione FINALLY. Over SPEW and in front of Harry, how perfect. I really just loved how this finally worked itself out, however random, just because I know Rowling has been teasing us and teasing us with it for ages. The woman was writing this couple for herself, for crying out loud. I'm just glad to see this plot point coming to a close. I really do like this couple, although I really can't say I like how it was handled for the story up until Hogwarts. Ron, jealous of Harry, whom he knows is totally lusting over Ginny? Hermione wasn't into Harry, and never really gave the impression. Horcrux or not, Ron's behavior was rather pathetic. On the topic of Horcruxes, who totally called Harry being one? I'm not the only one, I can tell you for sure. Hundreds of people called it. But the plot was a little too predictable. I had most of the deaths worked out even before the book's release, and the plot was worked out long before then. I'm a little disappointed that it was that simple, to be completely honest. And Harry totally should have stayed dead, by the way. I feel pretty stupid, but I still haven't figured out exactly why he lived aside from something silly involving magic or fate or whatever. If it's not as cheesy as I understood it, somebody please explain this to me? Because I must have missed something, or else he should still be dead in my book. Maybe Rowling was just too in love with her Harrykins to finish him off. Wish she had been that way for Fred. I bear this icon for you, Freddie. P.S. How are the Malfoys? Did anybody hear anything? I'm going to have to take a breather. I'm not done, I don't think, but I'm all flustered again, and considering ripping out a few pages and making a few corrections.

I want... I want to write a review and a letter and a few fanfic all at the same time about Deathly Hallows.

I'll update (spoilers included) when I'm sure I can discuss it without breaking down again.
And yes, I really was that moved.
And also that disturbed.
I'm a little overwhelmed, to be honest.

Zomg I just want to make a post and lj changes everything on me. On to the real topic. I saw Transformers on Tuesday (got there 5 min before the movie and actually gor in, woot) and I really must say I could make an entire entry on that. Having grown up a fan of Transformers, I could probably write a whole essay. Regardless, I wanted to make this post to let you guys know that I've nearly wet myself at the idea of JJ Abrams Cloverfield. I'm sorry, Untitled JJ Abrams Project. Nearly wet myself because it suits my tastes PERFECTLY. I can't. fucking. wait. Look it up. Try to watch the trailer... if you can find it (I have faith). I hope it isn't Gozilla, because that would be a very large disappointment.

Man. They say substances and I can't help but think it doesn't sound like it includes alcohol. This thing also makes me look very innocent. Enjoy, for your viewing pleasure.

The Everything Test

There are many different types of tests on the internet today. Personality tests, purity tests, stereotype tests, political tests. But now, there is one test to rule them all.

Traditionally, online tests would ask certain questions about your musical tastes or clothing for a stereotype, your experiences for a purity test, or deep questions for a personality test.We're turning that upside down - all the questions affect all the results, and we've got some innovative results too! Whew.

I gots so much to update.

I guess I should start with my trip across country. Literally. Unless you count the 2 hours to the East Beach, but that doesn't count considering how many hours we did ride. Anyway, I helped Kris and Rick move much of the Hutley Clan furniture to San Jose, Cali. So we rented a U-Haul, stuffed it full, and began driving. It was so gorgeous. To be honest I slept through just about all of the South because I've seen it (and lets be honest--it's all trees anyway). But soon as we were out of Arkansas on the second day, it was like a whole new world all over again. Granted I lived in Houston for a few years, but it was strange for it to suddenly be DRY and FLAT and able to see for miles. And holy cow was it beautiful. The people were really nice, the roads weren't that bad (with the exception of OK) and I watched the most gorgeous thunderstorm I have ever seen. Of course, this was the same storm that all through OK City had our eyes peeled for tornados (and I didn't even get to see one funnel).

And then we hit up New Mexico, which was a whole new experience for me (and to be honest, one big blur of cacti and dust). Then we hit up the Grand Canyon, which was a little out of the way but still worth it. It totally snowed while we were there. I have tons of pictures but I have to translate them from their raw format, so it may be a while. But stick around because they're totally worth it. The snow was gorgeous and completely unexpected.

I guess I should sum up the rest quickly. We successfully made it to San Jose and just in time for Fanime. I can officially say that my Convention cherry has been popped, and I am addicted. It was so much fun that I've alreayd planned our Dragon*Con/AWA adventures. I know I'm totally jumping in over my head here, but I'm thinking of attempting Ashe and Basch for Kris and I for those. I'll have to get started immediately if I even want any hope of getting the armor done in time, but I'm really excited now. Btw -- all my seamstress buddies dying to do some charity work -- I am/have taught myself the art of sewing but clearly we all know that means that I suck, so if I can commission you or something into helping/making some stuff for me... *puppy eyes*
j/k. The whole project will probably fall apart like it always does. But Fanime was awesome regardless.

Then we hit up San Francisco, which if somebody hasn't been there, I highly suggest it on a warm day. It was quite cold while we were there but it was very nice to see everything nonetheless. Monterrey Bay was the same, as were the Red Woods. They were all gorgeous and I got some ok pictures on those days, so again I'll have them up ASAP.

My wrist is hurting now though so I guess this is me out. Maybe one day I'll actually have a real update, or at least a long one.

btw, going camping tomorrow SQUEE

*squee*

We got confirmed on an apartment today and it looks sooooooooooo nice! It's not too big, but I'm not complaining because it's big enough and it's RIGHT in Tech Square -- aka Trolley and 5 minute walk included. PLUS it's got a balcony that overlooks the courtyard and now I'm just too excited about moving in -- Squee!!

Now, about getting it furnished...

So, I just updated my page and now it looks fancy.


I'm in love, but it's still in progress. Yesh. And this is entirely because I am finally free of work and school... YESH.

In case anybody is curious (because I know you were thinking about it as you went to sleep last night), I tried on my bodice tonight for the Renaissance Faire tomorrow... and I actually tightened it to make it fit BETTER.

*squee*

On a similar note, IF YOU NEVER HIT THE GEORGIA RENAISSANCE FESTIVAL, YOU TOTALLY SHOULD. IT WILL ROCK YOUR SOCKS.

Having a bit of a crisis with it metaphorically raining a lot lately. Especially when we all know that when it rains, it pours. Maybe I should have saved those left over dreams Funny, but here's that rainy day Here's that rainy day they told me about And I laughed at the thought that it might turn out this way Where is that worn out wish that I threw aside After it brought my lover near It's funny how love becomes a cold rainy day Funny, that rainy day is here Funny how love becomes a cold rainy day Funny, that rainy day is here -Brenda Lee

All fun aside, I send my condolences to the people I don't know: the victims of the attack at VT today. We updated ourselves all during Studio today, and I am shocked and horrified and to be honest, a little frighted and unnerved. To think such a beautiful campus, such a fantastic college, could become so quickly a bloodbath...

Bush really said it right this time. School are supposed to be our sanctuary, our homes for knowledge, where we can give life... and today, they were a place where no campus felt safe, and life was taken insead.

They are all in my prayers.

-Nor dread nor hope attend
A dying animal;
A man awaits his end
Dreading and hoping all;
Many times he died,
Many times rose again.
A great man in his pride
Confronting murderous men
Casts derision upon
Supersession of breath;
He knows death to the bone
Man has created death. 
-Yeats
Find my LJ Mojo! Thanks, Abby (I can't say glimmer anymore...) I'm super cool.
I know Courtney said it the other night, but she put it just so perfectly. When it rains, it pours.

I really fret far too much on the smallest of things. I should learn to relax much more. People don't think on things as long as I do (especially when it's ME making an ass of myself), so why should I, right?

On a brighter note, heya all, i'm still alive! And I LOVE Easter, yay.

So this new job I have...

Takes up a lot of time. I mean, really only about 17 hours a week, but it's a lot of time to me, haha.

Anyway, it's almost like I have the night shift because everybody leaves at 6 or 7 and I'm here until 9 with one or two other people. And we just... sit around [and do other work] in those 2-3 hours.

Pretty effing awesome.

I don't know if this is safe to post here since I can't remember who reads, but I was looking through some of my friends' facebook photos and found this from the College of Architecture's Industrial Design Second Year Studio: She designed that apron thing in a project where you design whatever. And while normally, I would have no problem (it's actually a very clever idea), the fact that I KNOW this chick is here for her M.R.S. (she actually announced it in class last year) just makes me kind of want to cry. Yay for women stuck in the 50's. Or maybe I'm just too feminist.
